intro: Gymnadenia × aschersoniana, commonly known as the hybrid grass of the genus Gymnadenia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor environments. Gymnadenia × aschersoniana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
